source.description: The URL used to derive to content of the feed
The URL used to derive to content of the feed

link.description: The URL to the HTML website corresponding to the channel

description.description: Phrase or sentence describing the channel

categories.description: An array of categories that the channel belongs to

language.description: The language the channel is written in

copyright.description: Copyright notice for content in the channel

managingEditor.description: Email address for person responsible for editorial content

webMaster.description: Email address for person responsible for technical issues relating to channel

pubDate.description: The publication date for the content in the channel

lastBuildDate.description: The last time the content of the channel changed

generator.description: A string indicating the program used to generate the channel

docs.description: A URL that points to the documentation for the format used in the RSS file

cloud.description: Allows processes to register with a cloud to be notified of updates to the channel, implementing a lightweight publish-subscribe protocol for RSS feeds

ttl.description: Number of minutes that indicates how long a channel can be cached before refreshing from the source

image.description: Specifies a GIF, JPEG or PNG image that can be displayed with the channel

url.description: The URL of a GIF, JPEG or PNG image that represents the channel

title.description: Describes the image, it's used in the ALT attribute of the HTML <img> tag when the channel is rendered in HTML

link.description: The URL of the site, when the channel is rendered, the image is a link to the site

textInput.description: Specifies a text input box that can be displayed with the channel

title.description: The label of the Submit button in the text input area

name.description: The name of the text object in the text input area

link.description: The URL of the CGI script that processes text input request

skipHours.description: A hint for aggregators telling them which hours they can skip, which takes the form of an array that contains up to 24 numbers, between 0 and 23, that specify a time in GMT

skipDays.description: A hint for aggregators telling them which days they can skip, which takes the form of an array that contains up to seven strings, with possible values of

author.description: Email address of the author of the item

categories.description: An array of categories that the item belongs to

comments.description: URL of a page for comments relating to the item

enclosure.description: Describes a media object that is attached to the item

length.description: How big the media object is

type.description: The MIME type of the media object

guid.description: A string that uniquely identifies the item

pubDate.description: Indicates when the item was published

source.description: The RSS channel that the item came from
